intro: Senecio greenwayi, commonly known as Greenway's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio greenwayi is often found in open areas such as grasslands and along stream banks.
